job_description: Research Scientist / Statistician [Education & Public Health] - job post Far Harbor, LLC Austin, TX 78701 $92,000 - $124,000 a year -  Full-time Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $92,000 - $124,000 a year Job Type Full-time Experienced candidates (7+ years) only please. Summary: The Research Scientist / Statistician collaborates with a friendly team of scientific staff who design and analyze public health and education research. Join us in making a positive impact in the world while helping to grow our statistical research firm in downtown Austin. NOTE: *All* candidates must submit a cover letter with resume to be considered; see Application Requirements below. Position Description Far Harbor helps major clients to evaluate programs that aim to improve public health and education in the US and globally. We seek an experienced applied social science researcher with extensive knowledge of research methods along with excellent project management and consulting skills. The Research Scientist / Statistician collaborates with directors and fellow team members on long-term research and client projects. You will assist scientific staff, conduct analyses of population health surveys, oversee data preparation and confirm quality, develop analytic plans, review research products, and participate in developing peer-reviewed journal publications. Experience you will bring to our firm PhD (preferred) in sociology, economics, psychology, public health, or related social science (or Masters with strong experience) At least 7+ years of professional experience as an applied researcher Proven track record contributing on research teams and projects Scientific or research consulting experience a plus History of excellent writing and familiarity with the scientific publication process Solid graduate-level statistical training required (probability, sampling, general linear models) Proficiency with SAS, Stata or other statistical software; statistical programming expertise strongly preferred Talents and values we share Communication Presents concepts logically and clearly Speaks and writes succinctly to maximize impact across different audiences Translates complex research into actionable results Interacts smoothly with many types of people Creativity and Perspective Generates new and unique ideas Offers original, supportive thinking in group brainstorming Takes a broad view of an issue/challenge Proposes achievable future scenarios Considers individual, team and client interests in solving problems Scientific Expertise Brings knowledge of various research designs, particularly for causal inference in observational studies Understands pitfalls to analysis in program evaluation, such as non-random samples, non-equivalent groups, and selection bias Demonstrates expertise in applying statistical methods to answer research questions Understands the full spectrum of social science data, from surveys to administrative sources Diversity and Collaboration Fairly considers alternative perspectives Manages all sorts of people equitably Interacts with diverse personalities as a team player Brings a mix of analysis, wisdom, experience to decisions Finds common ground to solve problems for the good of all Sought out by others for guidance Motivation and Mentorship Creates a culture in which people want to do their best Invites input and shares ownership and recognition Makes everyone feel his/her work is important Empowers others in decision-making Welcomes challenging and stretching assignments Humility and Humor Quickly admits flaws and mistakes Is modest, self-effacing and respects the views of others Brings light-heartedness and good humor even when things go awry Compensation $92k-124k/year (based on experience) with profit sharing and bonuses based on company performance. Vacation, holidays, flex work benefits and company-paid access to the on-site gym. About the Company Far Harbor, LLC (http://farharbor.com) is a statistical consultancy established in 2000 and based in Austin, TX. The firm offers expert research and analysis consulting to a number of federal, state, and international clients. We serve public agencies and philanthropic organizations by assisting in the design and analysis of field research and population studies. We enjoy a collegial work environment and are motivated to provide excellent scientific work for our clients. Work Location This is a hybrid full-time position at our downtown Austin TX office (Tues-Wed-Thur), with telework (Mon & Fri). Our modern offices include a fitness center with showers for walking/running/biking to work. Occasional travel might be required (2-3 trips per year for client meetings). Application requirements Please respond to this posting with the following items: a well-written cover letter referencing this position and your primary qualifications and goals, -and- a detailed CV or resume containing education, experience, and any specialized or technical skills relevant to the position. Candidates who do not provide the above items or fail to meet the minimum skills/experience requirements will not be contacted. Qualified applicants will receive confirmation of receipt by email, and top candidates will be notified personally. EEO Statement: All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin. Please no recruiters or contract agencies. Thank you for your interest. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $92,000.00 - $124,000.00 per year Benefits: 401(k) matching Flexible schedule Health insurance Health savings account Paid time off Professional development assistance Relocation assistance Schedule: Monday to Friday Supplemental pay types: Bonus pay COVID-19 considerations: We follow CDC guidelines during pandemic spikes. Ability to commute/relocate: Austin, TX 78701: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Preferred) Education: Master's (Required) Experience: Research and Consulting: 7 years (Preferred) Work Location: One location Health insurance If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.
